Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Monika H
Reviews.Content: We were there in the beginning of March 2012. The hotel is at a strategic position so everything is very close to it. The staff is very friendly and ready to help. Our room was very clean and tidy. The only thing my husband and I didn't like was that the shower cabin was a little bit small. The breakfast wasn't very plentiful but it was tasty. I can honestly say that it's worth every euro we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maaju-
Reviews.Content: Our room was really clean (and cleaned every day), staff was friendly and breakfast was good. Hotels location is great, we walked there to everywhere. Bus stops, railway station and metro station were also near by. Only bad things to say is that the walls were thin so we could hear all that happened on corridor and that the hotel had no internet connection. Overall the hotel was very pleasant and we really enjoyed our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “A clean and comfortable base to explore this wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Clairol84
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel having read the good reviews on trip advisor and we weren't disappointed. The rooms themselves were clean and well presented and we weren't disturbed by any road noise or noise from neighbouring rooms. The bed, although slightly on the hard side, provided a very good nights sleep. The shower was amazing, very powerful and always hot. Breakfast was continental style and was more than adequate to prepare us for the day ahead. Staff were friendly, very helpful and speak good English, which is important if, like me, your Italian is very limited. The location was definitely the highlight of this hotel, being approximately 10 mins walk from Termini station and within walking distance of all the main attractions (we even walked to and from the Vatican). There are numerous restaurants in the surrounding streets, and if you eat away from the main piazza's dinner can be very reasonably priced! The only negative thing we can think of is that the hotel is located on the 3rd floor and if you don't fancy getting in the old lift (we were never brave enough to try it) you will have to carry your luggage up a number of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Room”
Reviews.Author: joaomadrid
Reviews.Content: Near a major street, a few blocks away from the subway and very close to some of the most famous attractions. The staff was very helpful and the room was completely new. The only downside is the lack of Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,poor service”
Reviews.Author: Sofia_Ath
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel, we were surprised to see that the elevator was working only from and to the first floor. Therefore we had to carry the luggage up to that floor and take the elevator to the third floor where the hotel was situated. Upon our check in we were welcomed by a very friendly and professional receptionist, named Massimiliano, who needless to say, helped us through our whole stay. The hotel had 4 men working at the front desk and along with Massimiliano, only another man( I am sorry, but I don't remember his name-he used to work the night shift) were helpful. The other two, including the owner's son did not live up to our expectations. Both my friend and I have been working in the field of tourism for over 10 years, I am a tour guide and she works in a hotel. Anyway, the location was as described on trip advisor by other subscribers and was very close to almost everything. Although we were satisfied by the location of the hotel,since it was our first trip to Rome and needed one that would allow us to go to several places on foot, I can not say the same thing about the service in general. Entering in the room, a bag filled with used paper, used by the previous tenants had not been removed from the bathroom. Moreover, the towels and the sheets did not smell as if they had been washed, they had a bad smell. Even the closet where we would hang our coats, had a funny smell and when we would take them out of it, they would smell terribly bad. During our first night, it was very cold (we were unlucky/lucky to have arrived in Rome when it was snowing!!) and we tried to turn on the a/c but it was not working, so we called the front desk to ask if they could fix it. When the receptionist showed up, by just looking at the indication and not checking anything else, he said "But it is working. The sun means that hot air is coming out". And that was that for him, but my friend asked him to check the ventilator because not only was there not hot air coming out, but the small proportion of air circulating in the room, was cold. Anyway, he did not seem very happy to be bothered, but after protesting about it, he went and checked it through a main system and fixed it. We only had breakfast one day before we departed and I can say that we were not very pleased by it. The coffee was good, but everything else looked like it had been bought by a super market and was not very fresh. Next to the hotel there was a little coffee shop, named "dolci dolcezze", where we would have our morning coffee to start the day, (very cheap coffee and very very tasty) and something to eat. Everyday douzens of Italians would pass by to have something to drink or eat before they went to work. It is one of the best memories we have from Rome. Overall, the hotel was close to everything either on foot or by metro/ public bus transportation, the rate was reasonable for ist category, but I think there are a lot of things to be fixed, before I can recommend it. P.S make sure you are aware of the fact that you will be charged for the tax which is not icluded. The charge is 2 euros per person per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: UpstateMom4
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there in late October for three nights. Paid about 110 Euros/night. Was clean, quiet, adequate breakfast. Not having internet was inconvenient, but there is an internet place about a block away. Best tip concierge gave us was to watch for pickpockets! We went right back to our room and put away all valuables and extra money in the room safe. Excellent location - we walked EVERYWHERE. This is not a hotel with a lot of services, but we were really only at the hotel to sleep and eat breakfast. Great restaurant at the end of the street. Oh yah - very firm beds!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ariel F
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel Galatea. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and it is a great location! Staff was excellent. They were friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. We needed to refrigerate medication for the week we spent in Rome, and the hotel was more than happy to oblige. And a friendly smile and wave when you come in or leave goes a long way in making a great vacation. Location cannot be beat in terms of centrality. Situated a 5 minute walk to both of Rome's subway lines, a 10 minute walk to the Termini train station, Colosseum and Forum, and a 1-minute walk to a number of bus lines that will take you anywhere throughout Rome, including directly to the Vatican, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiori, and anywhere else. Not to mention, you can just walk the streets of Rome (30 minutes to almost anywhere in the central core). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wome”
Reviews.Author: jame m
Reviews.Content: enjoyed staying here positives quirky old building but modern hotel great location regards sights/transport good resturants nearby (est est est) decent if basic breakfast good discount price £50 a night negatives being told you cant have a bath plug as you havent booked a room with a bath even though they had given us a room with a bath hard hard beds bit noisy in rooms near reception not the most helpful reception staff (would help us validate a jet2 booking form) result: would stay again. oh and Rome is fantastico

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Hotel Galatea for 4 days at start of December”
Reviews.Author: gracey13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Galatea for 4 days at the start of December 2011. We are a young couple (aged 22 and 23). We looked at many hotels online before finally booking this one and it was done purely for the price. We paid £200 for two people for 4 nights B&B which is exceptionally good for the location of this hotel in Rome. We got a bus from the airport to Termini, and then walked to the hotel. It took about 10minutes with 2 cases! Look up walking directions on yahoo maps from Termini to the Hotel before you go and you will have no problem...easy! The hotel is in a building of many floors (containing apartments and some businesses) so there are a lot of stairs - but there is also a lift, which like stated in other reviews, is a bit creaky and old-school but works none the less and helped out after a long day of walking! Hotel staff are very lovely and very helpful, the manager is great (tall slim man with dark hair). There is someone at the desk 24 hours a day which I always find comforting. They have maps at reception and will help you out with directions and bus numbers etc. Rooms are basic but spotlessly clean and cleaned well every day. Bathroom is very nice and always spotles. Beds are very hard but I hear this is normal in Italy and it didnt stop me sleeping! Each room has a unit on the wall where you can control the AC/Heat which was great as it wasnt summertime and I am always cold. There is also a safe in the room which you dont need to pay a deposit for...i'ts ready to go. This was very handy and we used it. Negatives about the room - there are no tea/coffee making facilities which we really missed. Also, although it won't matter to some - the TV doesnt have any english channels. We dont drink so we were getting back to the hotel about 10pm and luckily we had books and magazines and also brought an ipod with mini speakers, but usually when we are away there are 1 or 2 channels that we can stick on in the background. The hotel also doesnt have Wi-Fi but the manager told us he is going to be doing this in the New Year and I am sure it will say on their website when they do. Little facts! The hairdryer - for girls like myself who have very long and naturally wavy hair ...it's very old school and weak but it did the trick. We were flying with Ryanair so I couldn't afford the extra weight to take my own but I survived with their hairdryer - and brought my own mini-straigthners to smooth over after! You dont get any proper shampoos/conditioner so either bring your own or buy them at the wee shop accross the street. Breakfast - is basic but it did the trick. For fussy eaters it may not be too great. There are 2 cereals, an oaty one and a corn flake type one. Croissants, mini rolls and fruit cocktail. There are a selection of jams also. There is plenty of tea and coffee (my boyfriend cannot function without his morning coffee and was having many cups to fill up!) but this is only available at breakfast time which is 7am until 10am I think it was. I am quite particular but just ate anyway to start the day! Main sites... Trevi Fountain (which is where we ended up every night for pizza and gelato) is about 10-15 minutes walk. Colosseum - about 10 mins walk. Pantheon - about 10/15 One day we even walked back from the Vatican which was about 40 minutes although you can get the 64 bus accross the main road outside what looks like a big Museum (you will know the building when you see it...its at the end of the hotels street, big grand and white!). This bus (the 64) will take you to Vatican City if you stay on till the end. The bus stops are really easy to read so dont be scared to use them! We didnt in fear of getting lost but by the last day we could hardly feel our feet and tried it and its so easy. We just got on and off and managed to see all the sites one last time (starting from The Vatican Museum) in about 5 hours! So the bus stop next to the hotel is very handy. There is a pastry/coffee shop right next to the hotel which was very handy after breakfast time was over in the hotel. There is also a few restaurants on the street but we did not try them. There is also a little grocery store accross the street which was handy for juice/chocolate/crisps/fruit to take back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BOOKING NIGHTMARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: angela1976
Reviews.Content: What an absolute rip-off. I booked this hotel online and they have been deducting money from my account without notice. I have tried in vain to contact them to rectify the problem but the proprietor "Antonio" does not respond to emails regarding CREDIT CARD FRAUD!! There are so many other hotels in Rome, I'm kicking myself for choosing this one.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Vacation November 2011”
Reviews.Author: Phil B
Reviews.Content: Only 10 minute walk from Termini bus station, the hotel is nicely situated for easy access to all significant tourist attractions such as the Coliseum, the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, the Vatican & the Pantheon. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was limited with a choice of two cereals or croissant, orange juice or water, tea or selection of coffees - ideal for setting you up for the day and was very good quality none the less. Hotel staff were very friendly and happy to offer advice on where to go and how to get around the city. Nice selection of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance from Hotel. Would definitely stay here again as the location, price, cleanliness, helpfulness & friendliness of staff couldnt be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “good for walking to many of rome sights”
Reviews.Author: justpinks
Reviews.Content: Very well placed hotel for many of the sights of Rome, breakfast basic pastries and cereals but at least we didn't have to venture out each day to find breakfast. Within easy walking distance of Trevi Fountain, Termini Station, Coliseum. would recommend this hotel as a budget, basic base for anyone visiting Rome, Rooms basic but they have what you need - bed and a bathroom - mattresses are 'hard' but we understand this is the norm in Italy and after long days taking in all the wonderful sights sleeping wasn't a problemm whatever the quality of the beds. Only negatives, no internet and no tea/coffee facilities in the room, didn't realise how much we would miss being able to make a drink at night or when we popped back to the hotel for a breather, the breakfast room had a coffee/hot drinks machine but this was only used for breakfasts - there are only a few rooms and I don't think people would mind paying a little extra for the odd hot drink now and again when at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Peta W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Galatea. We found the location great, central to many attractions, only a 10 minute walk to the Colluseum. The rooms are clean and comfortable and surprisingly large for a Rome hotel our previous experience has been alot smaller. The room was on the inner courtyard, it was very quiet considering where the hotel is situated. The staff were very helpful, organising our transfers to the airport and lots of information on the attractions and shopping in the area. The one thing that could be improved was the breakfast. It is very basic and we ended up eating at a local bakery. If we are going back to Rome i would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: MatDan1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find and value for money. The location is perfect for a tourist, walking distance to all the main sights. Rooms are nice and clean. The atmosphere is cosy. Breakfast is not great, but it's free. The only thing I didn't appreciate were the complete rip-off tours to the Vatican that they tried to sell us when we asked how to get there. 60 euros for a tour is ridiculous when you can buy the entrance and an audio tour for 20. So watch out for this and it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value and customer service.”
Reviews.Author: 413FLOZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the third floor of a typical Italian building, with a doorway leading into a courtyard and winding staircase around a lift. The location is ideal, near to Nationale, which is one of the main shopping areas. There are many local, reasonable restaurants nearby. The hotel is located between the Colluseum and Trevi fountain, each of which being about ten minutes walk away. Once inside the hotel it is definately worth more than two stars, it was exceptionally clean and all staff were eager to help in any way they could. The rooms were a good size and well decorated. The breakfast was a continental style with a choice of hot drinks, croisants, brioche, cereals, simple fruit salad and juice. I would definately stay here again and if you are looking for a clean, simple hotel in a good location I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: studyinaddis
Reviews.Content: Galatea hotel is an excellent hotel to explore Rome. The location is very convenient and staff are helpful. The rooms are nice and spacious. We would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ROME - GALATEA! 2 star? WAY BETTER THEN ADVERTISED!”
Reviews.Author: NICK H
Reviews.Content: What can i say... That hasn't been said. Had an amazing time in Rome and this hotel was perfect! We were only here for 3 nights (me and my GF) but could have stayed a few more. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel for being a 2 star. It is DEFFFFFFF way better then a 2 star!! The old building has so much charm to it. Really makes you feel like you're in Italy. The small lift is perfect after a long day of walking when you don't need to climb more stairs lol. Air Condition worked amazing (almost too good had to shut off a few times in night) , the bathroom was very new and super clean. Bed was firm but I prefer a strong mattress. So close to a lot of attractions and a skip to the subway system (which was very easy to use). Staff soooo soooo helpful and spoke great English. It was so nice to have someone there 24hours if we needed anything. I will definitely be back and staying at the Galatea, as well as recommending to any of my friends and family that are traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We Love it!!! Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tlumatt43
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in a central location. It is exactly how advertised but better. Great staff at the front desk. Julio, one of the staff, really gave us the VIP treatment. He helped us book our next hotels in Florence, recommended incredible local cuisine, and setup reservations for us at restaurants. The room was big and CLEAN. The bathrooms were big and clean. Great location, walking distance to everything. Or if you know how to use the bus or subway, stops for both were just a few blocks away. It was in a safe area and quiet street. We loved our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “When we visit Rome again, we know where we ll be staying!!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabet_Mp
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Rome! Its near everything so you rarely need a transportation to move around, in a good neighborhood so you never feel uneasy to walk back late at night, very clean and very helpful 24h smiling staff! Thank you for your hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great simple hotel, close to most tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Rikke2011
Reviews.Content: Staff: 24 h reception, very friendly and helpfull Rooms: newly refurbished - excellent shower, air conditioning. Nothing to complain about. Very clean. Breakfast: simple. croissant, bread (not fresh though), cereal... Location: 10 min walk to trevi fountain, 20-25 min walk to Pantheon, 15-20 min walk to Colosseum. 40 min. walk to Piazza del poppolo. The Vatican and Trastevere (great area for eating out) are a bit further away.

Reviews.Title: “For a two-star hotel, this is definitely worth 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Skephon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located nearby a main route (Via Nazionale) that has bus access to most of the major attractions. It's next to a pizzeria, and not that difficult to find (based on the reviews here I anticipated the worst). Just print out a small map of the area and you'll find it in no time. The desk employees are really helpful, and since they're there 24 hours a day, you can ask them anything. They were all very nice, and some of them were even heartwarmingly friendly. The rooms are small, but decent. It's clean, and I thought that especially the bathroom looked nice. However, I had expected a bath tub, since they mention that on the Expedia website, but there was only a shower. It doesn't have a fridge, which I thought was a bit of a shame, and the hotel doesn't have a computer or wi-fi available. They did have two televisions on the room though (an old model and a new model), so maybe they can sell them and buy a computer for it that hotel guests can use? So, the rooms were good but the one thing that bothered me a bit was the thinness of the walls. Thank god there were no annoying guests, because you could here everything from the hallway. This was only in the morning though, and it kind of helped us wake up so maybe you could see it as a positive point. The room was cleaned every day, the towels were replaced, but I believe the sheets weren't (we were there less than a week). Breakfast is, of course, very simple but okay. Some pre-packed toast, sweet croissants, cake, sweet rolls and canned fruit. A quick bite to start your engine, so you can go eat real Italian food later! If you're looking for a good hotel to stay in, know how to use public transportation and would rather spend your money on Italian food than on expensive hotels, I'd definitely recommend this one! I also liked the neighbourhood a lot! The area around Termini station seemed kind of shabby (if by any chance you were considering staying closer to Termini), but this area has a restaurant, supermarket and shops just around the corner! And not to forget you'll see the Collosseum every day :) It's a great place, and when we visit Rome again we'll definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: casbird
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this hotel before I booked, but because I had been two years ago I thought maybe people were being overly critical, how wrong could I be. The room we were given was dark, gloomy and miserable. The paint was peeling of the walls and was exceptionally dirty. The bed was rock hard, though surprisingly I slept ok. The guy at the front desk obviously didn't want to be there, I felt I was bothering him to ask for anything. On the plus side, the breakfast room was bright and the food was alright. I would not however recommend this hotel. I paid 94 euro for this room and could have gotten much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, but the worst breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: RomeLovers001
Reviews.Content: Good points: - The hotel is very good located - the staff is friendly - the room is nice and clean. Bad points are: - The hotel is located at the 3rd floor of a building, so you can take the elevator (which we didn't dare to take because it is way too old and creapy) or a lot of stairs. After a long day of walking in the city, these stairs are just too much. - The breakfast is really very very poor. Nothing is fresh, there was only a choice between croissants (with a very bad taste) and biscuits. Even the orange juice tasted like Fanta without the sparkles... Overall; for the price we paid for this hotel, you can find better places.

Reviews.Title: “perfect short break hotel”
Reviews.Author: beresfordgadd
Reviews.Content: Graet room. Very clean. Lovely towels. Staff helpful and friendly. Perfect location. Atmospheric entrance. Good but unvaried breakfast. The only annoyance was the lift which wasn't a problem the hotel caused - just inconsiderate people not closing the door. We would go back in a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mariathessaloniki77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - it was extremely clean and tidy - the lady who cleaned our room and served breakfast was polite and smiling all the time - the recepionists were extremely helpful nice and polite - the location is great - no complains at all. A great hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great price”
Reviews.Author: NoaFa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 4 nights and all in all it was great. The hotel served its purpose well, as the resting place between all the sightseeing. It has a great location, a quiet street right in the middle. The service was kind and the room was clean. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends, and if we will return to Rome we will consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “hotels in rome are Not cheap....but some are of good value, and galatea is one of them.”
Reviews.Author: jinx101
Reviews.Content: good location, clean room and friendly staff. breakfast (though not special) was good. the one thing we missed when we booked was that it is on the 3rd floor, which was not a problem, it just took us a minute to find it. i loved the balcony to the courtyard and spent a few minutes reading there every nite.and our son thought it was fantastic. speaking of which, the hotel staff was really great with the kids, which is often not the case...people see a 4yr old and a 2mo old and immediately act as if we are lepers. but our kids are well behaved and the staff was too :)

Reviews.Title: “Great time, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edzo33
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Rome and had an absolute amazing time. We arrived by train and the hotel was about a ten minute walk from the station (Termini). After checking in we began our sightseeing throughout the city. The hotel's location made every sight (The Colosseum, Pantheon etc) an easy walk. Staff were helpful with questions and the room was clean. Did not spend much time at the hotel but highly recommed it for its location and price. Historic pizzeria located just up the street which was great for a late dinner after walking around all day. Cab stand across the street, subway and bus lines also very close.

Reviews.Title: “Perferct location”
Reviews.Author: avihub
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is just perfect. A small street off Via Nazionale, in the city center. The rooms were lately gone through a complete renovation and were well maintained. The only drawback is the bed mattress which is too firm and so are the pillows. Breakfast is the normal Italian basic breakfast. Receptionist was very helpful. We enjoyed our stay there and highly recommend it, as it gives good value for your money. Important note : if you need Internet connection, it is not available (not even for money)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent inner city hotel, does what it does very well”
Reviews.Author: LankySiWat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights mid April2011 for a surprise anniversary gift to my wife. I literally spent hours looking at reviews, worrying about negative comments, comparing costs, locations etc as I didn't want to disappoint. I wanted to post a review to help other people who were also drowning in the options. I am pleased to say we enjoyed our stay at Galatea and would recommend it for a city break. To summarise and address some other review comments. Location - within easy walking distance to Metro line, bus stops, Trevi fountain and Colosseum. It's in an inner residential courtyard on 3rd floor only so it's not immediately obvious. We had no problems but if you are a single, more vulnerable type it may be a little disconcerting. We usually used the stairs but the lift, despite it's rickety looks, worked fine. Staff - excellent, courteous reception, willing to offer advice and spoke good english. Room 315. Large, very clean and well furnished. We overlooked a minor side street. Beds were on the firm side, but not uncomfortable and it is the Italian way. Bathroom large, but shower was a little small but more importantly always plenty of hot water. I didn't notice any significant smell from the drains. Quiet room for sleeping, you could hear the road (beep) and breakfast clear-up >8am but was never a problem as this room was away from serving area. Breakfast. There were no kitchen facilities so all food was pre-prepared / from a packet. More importantly it tasted fine and it was well attended so there was plenty of it. There were approx 4 tables x4 seats so I guess if every guest wanted to eat at the same time it would be crowded but never a problem for us. Maybe more of an issue in peak season. Value - hotels in Rome are as a rule not cheap, especially close to the city centre. I used booking.co and the price looked comparable to other similar hotels. I hope this helps. This hotel is a great place to recharge after a day spent seeing the spectacular and (often very crowded) sights on Rome. It's not 4 star, it doesn't pretend to be, but it is a simple city centre hotel done very well.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: MHGPotton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in March, excellent small hotel with very helpful staff. Situated just off Via Nazionale and only 10-15 mins walk from the main attractions. The staff were very helpful and ringed all the main places to visit on a map. The hotel looks as if it has been recently been refurbished and is very clean. Breakfast is Continental but plenty of it. First impressions are not very good when walking into the courtyard, but the hotel is excellent and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki_11_4
Reviews.Content: We satayed in hotel Galatea for 5 days and enjoyed every minute.The hotel is newly rennovated and located a 5 minutes walk from the center, on a small street near Via.Nazionale. Breakfast was really nice, great coffee :) The staff was very nice and helpful, the room was a normal size with a really good, big shower. The only disadvantage was the bed - a bit uncomfortable and hard... but we were so tired after a days walking, we didn't really care... Rooms were cleaned thouroly every day (the housemade even folded neatly my pajamas!!). I trully recommend this hotel, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, value for money and very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Cymru63
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a fantastic long weekend in Rome - never been before and booked everything over the internet. Took in the Italy v. Wales rugby match (my user name is probably a clue as to my allegiance!!), and managed to see most of the sights. What a great hotel! Brilliant location just off Via Nazionale, and walking distance to most of the major sights. The Vatican is a bus ride away (Route 64 from Via Nazionale) , although we took a cab. Walked everywhere else and was so impressed with Rome - the architecture, the people, the weather - just a fabulous city to stroll in, with everything in quite a compact area. Some reviewers have criticised the entrance to the hotel and the walk through the courtyard, but I thought that it had real charm and gave something of the flavour of Roman city centre living. The reception desk staff were unfailingly welcoming and very pleasant and on arrival we were given a really useful map. The receptionist took a great deal of care in giving us directions and advice. The room was recently refurbished and, although on the firm side, the bed was comfortable. The bathroom had an excellent drench shower with plentiful hot water and toiletries provided. Fresh towels daily added to the experience (if not the environment!). Breakfast was a little basic so we only partook on the first morning, but we paid £142 for a 3 night stay in the centre of Rome through hotels.com so I cannot complain at all - besides it was a good excuse for breakfast in a local cafe! If you want an inexpensive base for your trip to this wonderful city from which you can walk to most of the sights, look no further. This really is a great little hotel and I have no hesitation in recommending it!!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clauxmoi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic price and location - walking distance to most of the monuments. Room was clean, spacious and quiet. All the people who work there that we had to deal with were extremely helpful and pleasant. Breakfast is basic but good. Would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value but I just don't think I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MZE83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for 2 nights in December and decided on this hotel based on it's location and and proximity to Termini Station. An excellent choice in this regard. Walking distance to most major attractions and walking distance to the station. When we arrived, we were given a room that smelt terrible. It was so unbearable that I decided to notify the staff. A lovely gentleman came to check the room, immediately agreed promptly checked us into a different and bigger room. This room was fine but unfortunately after using the heating for a while we noticed the same smell (although less offensive) in this room. Im not sure what it was but it was very offputting. The beds are also quite hard and uncomfortable so it is not easy to get a great sleep. The rooms are however large, well appointed and modern looking. Breakfast was disappointing and we skipped it the second morning. Also- no wi-fi available anywhere in the hotel. Apart from the negatives, the staff were extremely lovely and the hotel was an excellent value choice in an otherwise expensive city. I probably wouldnt stay here again but I wouldnt necessarily warn others against doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ruthuk71
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect for us as we were only in Rome for 4 nights. It's about a 10-15 minute walk (depending on how much luggage you have!) from the main Termini train/bus station, about 10 minutes from 'old' Rome and about 10-12 minutes from the Trevi Foundation. It's located just off one of the main shopping streets with a supermarket, resturants, deli, clothes shops and pharmacy a few minutes away (as is the metro). The room was very clean and a reasonable size with a nice bathroom. Breakfast is included (we booked with Venere) and was basic but good and filling. As is often the case, you get two single beds pushed together when you ask for a double. Overall the room was quiet (it over looked a central courtyard) - not much natural light though. The staff were great, 24 hour reception and they looked after our luggage on the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: CharXib
Reviews.Content: I have visited very often this hotel and have always found a great service. The rooms are clean and spacious and everything works.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning from hotel breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BPetroff
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel through Splendia, which is supposed to be a luxury/boutique hotels only booking site. On the website it said the hotel was 4 stars but the minute you step into the courtyard inside the building the hotel is at, you start realising that you might have been fooled by that rating. The location is impeccable, I'll give them that, very easy to get to and from everywhere in Rome, super central. But the condition is disasterous. The painting in my room's walls was peeling, so was the wood from the windows. Sheets weren't changed, neither were towels, and neither was the soap in the bathroom. Rock-hard bed and pillows, ridiculously uncomfortable. Tacky decor, depressing even, very very far from a boutique hotel. Or even a decent hotel. Now let's talk about food - breakfast. Everything served is second-brand, like things you only see for sale at wholesale places like Booker, or discount markets Lidl or Poundland(in the UK). I'm not kidding. I had a peek in the pantry and there the were, the fruit salad from massive tin cans, the croissants and brad loafs from massive plastic bags.The coffee, from a vending machine (not a proper coffee machine) and this was in Italy (!) You think they'd get at least the coffee right. Finally, the little cheese pieces wrapped in foil, like those from "The Laughing Cow", were a copy brand called "The Happy Cow". Which were what I think sent me to the A&E in London 12 hours later. I had a three day trip with my sister and we ate exactly the same things, exactly, with the exception of the foil cheese and toast I had for breakfast on the last day that she hadn't. I started feeling ill at around 7pm when I was, thank god, already back in London, and then by the time it was 11pm my sister was calling the ambulance. The doctor said it was most likely this cheese and for sure something I had for breakfast, as the type of bacteria from bad food I contracted takes 8 to 12 hours to act on your stomach. I was in the hospital for 2 days on IV, and still recovering a week later. I strongly advise you to not waste your Euros on this hotel, and I cannot see how these other extremely positive reviews could be possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location from which to conquer Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Dust-E
Reviews.Content: What a great 2 star hotel. The staff is excellent. The rooms are spacious and clean with huge bathrooms. I couldn't believe it was a 2 star. The outside of the building that the hotel is in looks very run down, but once inside the hotel everything is modern and very well kept. The breakfast bar in the morning is a little lacking, but aside from that, I have no complaints whatsoever. This place really was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: meno69
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in the centre of Rome. Room was really large for inner city Rome and was very clean (the room including shower and floors were cleaned everyday). The included breakfast was pretty good considering they had limited facilities. The front desk was very helpful too and even let us use the toilets when we came back to pick our bags up after we had checked out. Bed was a bit hard though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: mullemor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Galatea is a fine hotel in the centre of Rome. Nice Rooms and exellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location in la bella citta Roma”
Reviews.Author: Jac_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Galatea - I travelled to Italy with my mum and sister & we spent four nights in Rome at Galatea sharing a large triple room which was spacious. All in all, it was good value, was close to all the major sites and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They even contacted us to arrange a pickup from the airport (EUR 55) which was great after the long flight from Australia and not bad value as taxi costs approx EUR 40 and train tickets are EUR 14 each. For a bit more detail, here are a few thoughts of mine: Proximity to the sights of Rome. We walked everywhere from Galatea as we are all happy to walk 10-20 minutes to get to the historical sites - Colosseo, Forum, Trevi Fountain etc. We even walked back from Trastevere one day. It was a great way to burn off all that pasta, pizza and gelati! For one day we did do the hop-on, hop-off tour which got us a bit further afield and although I would not recommend the company we used (the red double-decker company you find in every city in the world were absolutely hopeless in Rome) it was a handy mode of transportation if nothing else. The entrance. It is a little off-putting. I walked in thinking 'what have we got ourselves into here' as the "courtyard" is dark, a bit dingy and is certainly not welcoming. But don't be put off. Upstairs is a lovely, modernised and clean hotel. The lift. As so many other people here have commented - you really need to make sure the external door is shut when you get out at the hotel floor (it sticks), otherwise it wont work and you may leave other guests stranded at ground level with their luggage. I gave it a bit of a bump with my hip to make sure it was always closed. If you do get stranded, there is an intercom on the outside of the building (out on the street) and you can buzz up to reception and they'll shut the door for you so the lift will work. Amenities-wise this is pretty much a no-frills hotel. There are no fridges in the rooms or kettle etc, the beds are very firm and the pillows are slim. However the rooms are clean (cleaned daily) the fittings are new and our bathroom was great - big and nicely decorated. And it was super-dark and quiet with the shutters closed and the curtains drawn so we all slept very well. Breakfast was a typical Italian hotel affair - cold and sweet - which was fine for us. I enjoyed making my own little espresso every morning to have with it. The staff were really helpful and friendly. In particular one of the men who worked there pointed out places of interest and even a close-by laundromat. He also offered advice on visiting the Vatican Museum which was very useful. He suggested not to pre-book tickets like we wanted and to just line up since we were going in the early morning and the queues shouldn't be too bad. I admit, we were hesitant to follow this advice but he was right. The queue to get into the Basillica was long, but moved very quickly and after our visit there we walked around the block to the Museo and lined up for about 5 minutes to get in. So - there's a bit of advice for you, if you're going to the Vatican go early!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: giovane_americano
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in an old building on a quiet side street just off Via Nazionale, Hotel Galatea provides a welcome respite to the busy-ness of Rome. While the hotel's modern, somewhat minimalist decor may be seen by some as "no frills", Galatea is a comfortable hotel, and our modern (obviously recently renovated) bathroom was among the best we experienced in Italy. Just a few minutes' walk from Roma Termini train station, the Quirinale, and the ancient Roman Fora, part of the Galatea's charm is its location on an upper floor of the building, overlooking a central courtyard. (Worry not - there is a lift!) Good (but basic) continental breakfast, and friendly, helpful staff. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle76London
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a great position! Within walking distance to most attractions & on the bus route to the ones that a little far. Breakfast is a normal continental style and tasty, except for the coffee which was not nice at all, stick with the tea, hot chocolate or the espresso. The only down side is that the beds are very firm & the pillows very flat and no English TV channels but pitted against all the up sides to this hotel I don't think that matters I still had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: bededo
Reviews.Content: we arrived 20 th of March for the marathon the day after. the room of my friend was not available due to a technical problem, a room in another hotel was arranged but that was farther away from the starting place of the marathon (and only one taxi trip was offered); we supposed our own solution: my friend could stay in my room, but at first that was not allowed ! - later on: after picking our race number and having dinner, all at once another room was offered due to a cancelation ! - we had to be at the starting point at 08.00 - but breakfast was only offered from 7.30u, much too late: no flexible offer from them !! - because we returned the same day in the evening, we had to check out: we were not allowed to leave our luggage in the room of another friend who would stay for another couple of days ! - after the race we were not allowed to take a shower in room of our friend, only if we would pay 35 euro's each !!! just for taking a shower !!! each time we offered a solution to something that was rejected and there was always the threat of 'calling the police' ??!!...Italian hospitality ??????????????

Reviews.Title: “very bad experience and service !”
Reviews.Author: disappointment32
Reviews.Content: we booked 6 months earlier a doubble room and 2 single rooms. Arriving saterday 20/3 my room was not available due to bath room technical problem. I was suggested to go to another hotel - 1 star more - fore witch I got 1 taxi drive. My friends and I would run the marathon 21/3. A hotel much further of the start place was not comfortable. I choose to stay in Galatea with paying the same mony but lodging in my friends room. Later the evening I got a room in Galatea because one person did not come. All the hotel was booked by marathonrunners, but the breakfast was served at 7.30 u as usual too late for us, but no way to can eat half an hour earlier. We cheked out at 7.45 u but left our luggage there. The copple that was with us would stay another 3 nights in the hotel to visit Rome. As my friend and I arrived earlier than the copple after the marathon we couldn't use their shower - as was arranged between us - without paying 35 € per person to use the shower in our friends room ! Is this Italian generosity ? Because the elevator to the 3rd floor where the hotel is located doesn't work half of the times (the doors don't close firmly), we had to take the steps all times - not so easy after a marathon !

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dartadesign
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the old center of Rome, near Repubblica metro station (5 min walking) and Termini train station (20 min walking). There is a supermarket Despar on via Nazionale (2 min walking, goint to Repubblica metro station). The hotel is at the 3rd floor. The rooms are very clean, bathrooms are nice. The breakfast is not great, but it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “a good one”
Reviews.Author: sputnik-dot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a weekend trip to Rome. Smallest room every seen, but didnt spend much time there anyway. Very clean and nice bathroom. Things to improve: pillows, which are extremely thin and hard. Things that cannott be improved easily: sleep quality disturbed by weird noises of water running in pipes etc. Depends on how sensitive sleeper you are though. Breakfast simple and just enough before heading to Rome where you sure will fill your stomache with other food. Location OK, but nicest parts of city within a longer walk. Value for money: depends what you compare against, probably reasonable for Rome. Service very nice, helpful and friendly. All in all could be both much worse and a bit better - but hey, does it really matter when in Rome...?

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly,good located ,cute hotel....”
Reviews.Author: DalyaGocek
Reviews.Content: I went to hotel Galatea with my brother ..The location is simply perfect. Every part of Rome is just few steps away..Rooms are very clean and comfortable.Stuff is very friendly .The only thing i am not very happy is the breakfast. I recommend this beatiful hotel to serve some cheese and olives in the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jennyxobu
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and had a great stay. The rooms were clean and modern. The breakfast was good and the reception staff was very helpful. The only complaint I had was that the walls are paper thin and we had some very impolite neighbors who slammed doors and talked very loudly and this kept me up all night (for many nights). So if you are a light sleeper, beware. Otherwise, lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, cheap, clean"”
Reviews.Author: mdicion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Galatea for nine nights and had no complaints whatsoever. Our room was spacious and clean. The hotel itself looks to be newly renovated and the staff members were all friendly and helpful. Upon our arrival, they gave us a map of the city and pointed out some great places to shop and eat. Breakfast was good - not a lot to choose from, but it was just fine. My fiancee and I both agree that we got our money's worth. We will DEFINITELY be staying at Hotel Galatea when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: DevonFaith
Reviews.Content: Lovely little Hotel, don't be put off by entrance. Its behind big double doors, through a court yard and up by lift three floors, but a lovely surprise when you get there. Very pleasant staff who went out of their way to be helpful. Continental breakfast okay. Very clean rooms. If there is a downside, it would be the hard beds, although we got used to them! Rooms are a little dark as the bulbs are very energy efficient! I would recommend this hotel, it very reasonably priced and in the centre of everything, no need to use the bus or trains, except perhaps to Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “++++++Nice Small City Hotel++++++”
Reviews.Author: HogF
Reviews.Content: A small hotel located on the third floor of a side street off Via Nationale. Only 16 rooms. At least not discouraged when you walk into the courtyard. You will be surprised when you get up at the hotel. You will get a happy welcome from helpful staff. Clean and tidy both the premises and other facilities. Breakfast was basic and the pillows very flat and hard (no duvets) is missing chairs or a place you can sit and read the newspaper, etc. Very nice place. The hotel's location is perfect. Walking distance to almost everything. The overall impression is a lovely hotel, we could easily find on returning to this hotel and can highly recommend it to others. Our 5 day stay in Rome was really lovely. Temperatures between 19-23grader in November. Greetings from two Jyder (H and F)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Galatea in mid november, location is great, kinda in the middle, and the bus stop is 3 minutes away. one catch from the website, it is not 'walking distance' from Termini train station. It is close, but not within minutes. There are other hotels that are 3 - 5 minutes walking distance, Galatea is more like 20 minutes. The facade of the hotel is dissapointing, but who cares about the outside right? Room is on the large size, bathroom is clean, with clean towels and some amenities. TV is flat screen, however, because of the size of the room, it is kinda small, but since they have lots of channels options (english too) we were very happy. Breakfast is ok, for the price it's actually a plus. Service is fine, but when we asked for restaurant recommendation, the front desk guy 'recommend' us his 'friend' for 35 euro per person /dinner. and gave us a menu, etc. anyway we felt that he didnt give us any options, but push us to eat at that restaurant, so we didnt go. There are lots of restaurants in the area, do not fall into his trap. oh and other hotels usually have wi fi, this one doesnt.

Reviews.Title: “Our First Trip To Rome - A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Girls_Who_Shop
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by other friends who have stayed twice before. It is ideally situated for many of the famous attractions. The hotel was very clean. Lighting in the rooms could be a little brighter, and although we knew that breakfast was of a ‘continental’ style, I was a little disappointed with diluting orange juice, tasteless cereal, long life milk and packets of melba toast. Otherwise, as a reasonably priced hotel - it was perfect. The staff were attentive and very helpful – especially when I left my mobile phone behind. It was returned to me, by post immediately – and this additional effort was very much appreciated. Thanks to Massimiliano.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good value”
Reviews.Author: hanna_uk
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in Rome at Galatea Hotel. They location is great. Only a fifteen minute walk to a lot of attractions in Rome and also near the Metro line. Room was gorgeous and Breakfast was really good fabulous. All the staff could not have been nicer to us and gave us great recommendations for restaurants etc... The room has been booked online on bookhotelsinrome.com to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: DaveandKylee
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly doesn't have a grand entrance...reception on the 3rd floor of a private apartment complex. This in itself was something that we hadn't experienced before and had us thinking "What's the room going to be like?", but we were pleasantly surprised. - The room is very clean and the bathroom is pretty new - Our 3 days in Rome were all 35 degrees celcius +, thankfully the airconditioning worked very well - Breakfast was okay (but was included in the room price so no complaints) - Location was really good. We came in by train and only had to walk about 500m - The hotel is approx half way between the Spanish Steps and the Colosseum All thinks considered I'd say that the hotel is really good value for money. Nothing fancy but a great option for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: C-the-Whole-World
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Very clean room. We arrived at night and finding it was a bit interesting, but once we got to the third floor we were surprised at how modern, nice, and clean it was. Nice breakfast in the morning. Friendly front desk staff. Nice location, not far from the train station (we walked with our luggage from there).

Reviews.Title: “Lady Owner - Rude”
Reviews.Author: Smokeytn
Reviews.Content: Beware of the lady who owns this hotel....she is highly unprofessional and does not present herself well to her customers. This hotel is great in many areas to include location, breakfast, cleanliness, etc.; but the owner takes all this away with her rude and loud attitude. She does not have any appreciation for travelers. Hopefully, future guests will stay at this hotel when she is not working. The only other negative aspect of this hotel is the dingy courtyard you have to go through to get to a small elevator. The buidling in which this hotel is located could be spruced up to be a beautiful historical building. The bathrooms in our three rooms had been remodeled and were nicely done. Our rooms had new carpet and draperies. The breakfast was very nice and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great for our needs”
Reviews.Author: scotara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and only a short walk from the train station but is not really in that area as it is closer to the forum and the city centre. The hotel is pretty easy to find but it is in an old town block behind a large wooden door and first impressions are not great but the hotel inside is great. Once up the old lift and the hotel itself is on one floor of the building. The rooms are big and clean nad the staff very helpful. Breakfast is ok typical continental and there is plaenty of it. We were never in the hotel as rome has so much to offer so for the price it was perfect. Although it was not 5* we would never have been in a place like that so it made the choice of this hotel even bettter. Typical city hotel choice cheap as it is just to sleep in for 5 nights. I would stay here here again if i did not want to splash the cash. The location is close to the forum/colosseum area and a slighty longer walk to the Trevi as all is close to the Trevi we headed for this area first plus to get our Gelati fix.

Reviews.Title: “Only Good Things to say - Clean, Modern, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: danimartini
Reviews.Content: Central Location, slightly difficult to locate, but it is Rome! Stayed three nights. Staff so friendly, wonderful breakfast we were filled up on. Very quiet 3rd floor location, good room size, it is definately a step UP from basic. If you have a problem with this place, you are a Princess and you need to stop travelling and stay home where everything is how you like it.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfartable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tengiz
Reviews.Content: First of all thanks all the reviews ! They're all correct and very helpful. The room is very comfortable and practical plus very clean and a silence room. We were there 14-18 July but it's not hot in the room we didn't need to use air conditioning every time. An efficient breakfast is available and the lady in the breakfast room is so nice. We slept well, to me the size of the bed or room is just fine and most people wrote about it's hard to find the entrance actually it's very easy. We went there by foot from Termini and it's an ease walk in a good neighborhood and very good transportation links. The people on the reception area are also nice and polite. I higly recommend this hotel, we really appreciate our visit to Rome. We tried Est Est Est! yes all reviews are correct a very nice place with reasonable prices and it's good some that place very near to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: DEUT1959
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much and recommendid to everyone! Very clean, nice bathroom, close to the touristic sights, we did all by foot. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for central base”
Reviews.Author: noredpen
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for Wales' match in the Six Nations, so we wanted a cheap base. This hotel is a sweetie, based in an old palazzo, just off the Via Nazionale, but once through the door it is modern and pristine. Some reviewers criticise Italian streets, but if you go to an ancient city, ancient streets are part of the charm. The entrance led to a courtyard, complete with little fountain, wide doorways leading to marble stairs, with an ancient lift to one side. Bathrooms were lovely and there was a decent continental breakfast. I would stay there again, even though we were locked out one tired afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: maisie_muck
Reviews.Content: This was a good low cost option in Rome. It is close to Termini, metro stops and easily walkable to most landmarks in the city. The hotel is on the 3rd floor of a building so could be a little tricky for some people to find. You can get a lot of exercise on the stairs as the lift is pretty small, which didn't bother us but may be difficult for elderly people or people with a lot of luggage. Check in was efficient and staff made an effort all the time to ask if everything was ok or if we needed anything which was nice. Breakfast was limited but at least it was provided which is always good when on a budget. The room itself was fine, the only complaint being the bed was very hard and could be uncomfortable for some. The bathroom was quite nice and the room was cleaned very well each day. This was a good budget stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother you will only be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traveller61Miami
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel after dismissing our Taxi and dragging our luggage up to the 3rd Floor only to be told that they had a plumbing problem? and could not accommodate us, but had booked us in his brothers hotel on other side of Rome. This has happened to other people before so I was a bit suspicious(As I read in another review I thought it might be a once only event) The Hotel he booked us at was very nice and close to the Termini it was called The Astoria Garden Hotel. Book directly into that Hotel and you won't be disappointed or have to pay an extra cab fare as no compensation was forthcoming to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tripgirl31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two different occasions while we were in Italy, at the beginning of the month and at the end of the month. We were pleased both times. We found this hotel to be in a great location as it was fairly close to the metro and we could walk to all sorts of attractions. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and quiet. We were also happy that there was a bathtub in the bathroom, as we found a lot of Italian hotels (or the ones we stayed it), didn't have a tub. My only complain which is fairly minor is that the bed was rather hard. The air conditioning worked great, which was a blessing after walking around in the 35+ heat. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ECJCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this great hotel with two friends for a girls-trip to Rome this month. We booked a triple room which was great value for money. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, spoke English and was happy to recommend good restaurants (you should really try Alfredo's in Via della Scrofa if you get the chance!). The hotel's location was good in a small sidestreet to Via Nazionale (which kept the noise level down) but still only a 10 minute walk to Centro Storico. The hotel is small, but the triple rooms are nice and big, very clean and recently refurbished with new bathrooms as well. This is much more a three star than two star hotel! Only negative thing to mention are the somewhat hard beds and the rather simple breakfast - both which you'll find at other hotels in Rome, so that shouldn't really be held against this great hotel! Lastly, book this hotel directly through the hotel website - same price as hotels.com and the like, but you only have to pay upon departure, not in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: meybr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed five nights last September in hotel Galatea. We chose this hotel based on the reviews because of its location and we weren't disappointed. Walking distance to Colosseum, to the Termini station (for train and metro), two blocks from the bus stop, close to good restaurants. The room was very clean and modern and the shower was great. It also had a safe that they don't charge extra. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. One of the cons was the breakfast. Just a few options, so after a few days we started having breakfast in the café downstairs to vary a little bit (good and cheap). Also, as other hotels in Europe, the bed was a little bit too hard, so after a few nights our backs started complaining. The TV had only Italian channels which for us wasn't a big deal because we could understand but it would be nice if they had cable to have some international channels. But overall was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: britt00023
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Galatea over a weekend in September. We had a great experience. The staff were warm, friendly and informative. The location was great...quiet area, with a local feel, but still close to all the tourist spots. There were some great restaurants nearby too. The rooms were fairly sized, very clean and modern. The building where the hotel is located is very local...you feel like you live in Rome when you walk through the building courtyard and into the stairwell. All very genuine. We would definitely recommended to friends (and already have!).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lift”
Reviews.Author: seanymus
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel,then reading the reviews I would agree with the review about first impressions arriving outside. Once up to the hotel via the old style lift it was completely different. The staff were helpful.room clean with good A/C,the bed appears to be solid cement but is surprisingly comfortable. All in all excellent alround

Reviews.Title: “Canadians say Great value, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Ruttegger
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on www.venere.com, an excellent website to use when booking hotels in Italy that has great discounted rates. The location of the hotel is good, it's walking distance to the train station, Tivoli fountain, Coliseum, Opera house, internet cafe, shopping, etc. Our room was very clean, it had a good sized bathroom. The elevator is tiny but we were grateful there was one. The entrance to the hotel is not completely apparent, but once you find it, it's sort of novel how you walk through large wooden doorways into an inner courtyard. The staff were excellent, they gave us terrific recommendations for restaurants, they were friendly, they spoke English and they were attentive to our needs. Breakfast had a good variety of cold cuts, a selection of pastries, juice and espresso/capuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Galatea”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel once you get in. The outside of the building is not good, but once you go through the small elevator and get to the 3rd floor, is like you are in a whole different building. The inside is very modern, rooms and bathrooms are nice and clean. Front desk personel is kind and helpful. Location is good. You can walk to the Roma termini station altough we were tired of carring lugage and got a taxi for 9 euros(worth it). You can also walk to all major sites. The Vatican city is a bit far and we took the subway, but walked the way back. Breakfast is the worst part of the hotel. Only a coffe/cappuccino machine and some bread and juice. Doesn't even have any kind of ham. Other than that we had a very pleasent time at Galatea Rome. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stkr
Reviews.Content: It's is cozy, clean and quite nicely renovated hotel with a friendly staff. It has a beautiful contemporary design, gorgeous 4 ps bathrooms, wi-fi and a/c. It was a great pleasure to stay there. Highly recommended to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect couple break at Hotel Galatea”
Reviews.Author: sazzler61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Galatea for 4 nights in July 2008. The man behind the desk upon our arrival was extremely helpful and well presented, pointing out all the main sites and ways to travel around the city. The room was really nice- spacious, modern and clean. Had a safe which you did not have to pay extra for. Towels were replaced every day, and as we had an early flight out, the hotel even prepared our room an hour earlier than usual so it was ready for us when we arrived. Reception also booked us a taxi to take us back to the airport for 50Euro. The hotel was in a great location- 30 seconds from Spar supermarket, bus stop and newstand (where you can buy tickets for bus and metro.) The number 64 bus runs all the way from Termini Station, down Via National (the main street off which the hotel is situated) all the way to the Vatican. Runs every 5/10 mins and costs 1Euro. Hotel is also 15 mins from Colleseum, and similar time to Trevi Fountain. Spanish Steps a little further but the metro goes straight there and there is a metro stop at Republica Sqaure (at the end of Via Nationale). Rome itself was amazing. Tip for the Colleseum ( the only place with a long queue) walk to the front and buy an audio guide. IT costs an extra 4E but you get in straight away with it. You dont even have to pick up the audio guide if you just want it as a queue jump. All in all, really good, price was good compared to most in Rome. Would definitly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very clean, Professionally run, Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: This hotel comes highly recommended. It is cozy and clean and is in a great location. You can find it easily by walking from the Termini rail station towards Piazza della Republica and then following via Nazionale until you find via Genova (which is a left turn). The hotel is towards the end of the street again on the left. If you don’t mind a small-ish room with basic amenities then you are going to love this hotel. It is clean and new with a really good bathroom and a great shower. The staff are discreet yet friendly and professional, never once getting in the way whilst providing regular and thorough room service. The bed was comfortable and the room had a good-sized safe and wardrobe. I guess it would have been nice to have one English speaking news channel on the TV but to be honest we watched maybe 10 minutes of TV in 4 days so it wasn’t a problem – there’s just too many great things to do in Rome and this hotel is right in the action really. I recommend hiring a bike or a scooter from the bike shop which is close by (Bici e Baci I think it was called, really good prices) and then you can see all of Rome without relying on public transport. Most of the major attractions (Coliseum, Trevi etc.) you can walk to but having the bikes meant we could go easily to the Vatican and also make it back to the things which we wanted to revisit. It was a joy to ride along the banks of the river and stop at the coffee houses and wine bars whilst making our way back to via Genova. Via Genova, by the way, has a couple of really good restaurants in it and the area itself (whilst quiet) is not far from a couple of good wine bars and restaurants in other nearby streets. A bonus was finding an enoteca that served a pretty good version of aperitivo at the end of via Nazionale only 10 minutes from the hotel. We have friends who have stayed in suburban areas of Rome that commented on how difficult Rome was to get around. We had the opposite experience with Galatea as our base. We didn’t try the breakfast so can’t comment on that – sorry. Overall we found this hotel to be great value and in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value OK for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ashe17
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a double bedroom. Positives: 1) Good location - The Hotel is within 10 minutes walking distance from the central train station and is easy to find. - The 64 bus runs along the main road which is 3 minutes from the hotel and this bus will take you all the way to Vatican City for EUR 1 each way (buy ticket at the news stall on the corner). - 10-15 minutes walk to Trevi Fountain. - 10-15 minutes walk to the Colosseum. 2) The room and bathroom was clean and also had a safe. 3) Staff at the counter was friendly and helpful. 4) Breakfast was simple but good. Negative: 1) The price was quite steep approx 140 EUR per night. However, it is difficult to find cheap accomodation in Rome. Overall, this is a good 3 star hotel and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marydairy
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. The location of this hotel is it's best feature. It is within walking distance to the Termini, underground station and most of the historical sites. The hotel itself is on the 3rd floor of a residential apartment block which I personally liked. If you are after 5 star accomodation then this is not the right hotel for you.The rooms are clean and bathroom consisted of a bath and shower which was brilliant. As others have commented, I can confirm that the bed is hard and takes a little getting used to. There is no lounge or bar area at the hotel but there is a lovely restaurant right next door to the entrance to the hotel where good food and wine were sampled. This hotel is a good choice if you want reasonable priced accomodation which is central to the tourist trail. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Emjay7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great few days in Roma. The Hotel is only 10 minute or so walk from Termini station, off Via Nazionale. Dont be put off by the entrance to the hotel, we wondered where we were coming to , but after using the very small antiquated lift, we arrived at floor 5 and the hotel. We were greeted by friendly staff who were helpful in pointing out on a map, where we were in realtion to places, and suggested sights to see, then took us to our room, which was modern and clean, and quite spacious. The bathroom also excellent with a great shower. Breakfast was simply, but adequate. Next door to the hotel is a restaurant New Mary Meeting, which was very handy for the first night., although there were others close by, The hotel is situated very well to get round Rome on foot, only 10-15 minutes from the Forum. We booked 24 hours on the open top bus which was good value. If you go the the Trastevere area, I recommend a great local Osteria at 41 Via della Lungara, and in the Camp de Fiori Baffetto 2, a simply pizza restaurant, but great food. I would certainly recomment this hotel for a week end for its central position for sightseeing, and all the helpful friendly staff who made our stay great.

Reviews.Title: “hotel galatea”
Reviews.Author: grooviechique
Reviews.Content: just returned from rome stayed in hotel galatea very central and easy to get to all attractions. room was nice, cleaned every day. bed very hard would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “an honest review of Hotel Galatea”
Reviews.Author: johnnyminneapolis
Reviews.Content: Just got back 7 nights. The entrance to the hotel is not easy to spot from the street as it is off a main street, Nationale. once you find it, you have to walk through a dirty looking cement alley foyer to get to the main door of the hotel building. turn left and there are steps and a lift. use the lift, which is small and can only fit two people with their bags. go to the third floor. once there, go into the frosted glass doors into the hotel foyer. the hotel is on one floor, 3rd floor of a building. there is 17 rooms. we had 301, orange room, with a walk out window to balcony. which was at the end of the hallway. the entire hotel hallways is nicely painted, clean and bright. the people at desk we helpful, spoke english too. they were helpful and courteous. maid service cleaned everyday although, right outside our door was the maid service closet so they were noisy in the morning while we were trying to sleep. Now the bad stuff... the entrance is dark, dingy and almost looks like a alley with cars and mopeds parked there. trash is put out every day too. so it is not attractive at all. the hallways up to the hotel are dark and dirty too and can use some paint. the lift is tiny but worked fine. the rooms are tiny. you have about 2 feet of space around the bed. but the ceilings were high so that helped make it look a little larger. the bathroom in 301 is tiny. it is about 3 feet by 6 feet, the shower is 3x4 feet and tiny. the water pressure was fine and water was hot. the bed is hard. almost like laying on a carpet floor. so if you like soft beds, this is not the place for you. The breakfast is nothing to rave about. it is continental; cereal, bagels that seemed to be 2-3 days old and milk and coffee from a machine. not anything great but it's included. don't expect a real breakfast such as omletes or anything to that nature. a few days into our stay, we smelled a weird smell in our room and we thought maybe it was just us that smelled, dirty clothes, etc. but in reality, the smell was in the hallways too. not too disturbing but you can notice it. so not sure where it was from, possibly a sewer or drain letting out gases??? not sure what they were nor did we ask them about it. the hot water heat broke on our last day there so there was no hot water for showers. it didnt bother us since we were leaving that day, but i'm sure all 17 rooms of people who had stayed were not happy. Also, the hallway is all marble floors and no tapestry, so you hear everything that is going on from the hallways into your room. it echos right through the doors. so you hear people closing doors, talking, footsteps, maids walking up and down, clanking, etc. so it can be a bit noisy if you like to sleep without noises. the rooms share a buiding that people live in, so you will hear the neighbors too at times. we heard someone doing the italian-bump a few times, but lucky for us, it took him only 10 minutes. but it was loud enough to wake us. the water pipes are probably plastic PVC too because you hear the water swishing through them when they flush toilets, run showers amd sink water, etc. which is a bit noisy too. It is not exactly close to the major sites so prepare to walk. 15-20 minutes to coluseum, 5 minutes to republica and train station, 20+ minutes to spanish steps, etc. The vatican is a long walk. the location is good though, on side street off busy Nationale, which has some good stores, restaurants, etc. Overall, this is a safe clean hotel in a safe area. the staff were helpful and friendly. spoke english too. for a budget hotel, under 100euro a night, this is a good decision because i felt it was safe and the rooms were cleaned everyday too with new towels, etc. the location was pretty good too but if you want to be in the hub of the city, i suggest a hotel near Navonna or the Pantheon, which is a little more centralized to everything. if questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for little money”
Reviews.Author: alexbogd
Reviews.Content: A modern, recently refurbished hotel in a stone's throw from the historic centre of the city. The hotel is rated as a two-star, but is more convenient than many three-star hotels. The room was reasonably spacious and the bathroom simply excellent. The staff was friendly at all times. There are only two weakness. First, the breakfast is meagre, though of normal quality, but this is a distinguishing feature of Italian hotels. Secondly, the noises from the corridor was audible at all times. But still, the hotel was excellent and for shore one of the best choices in Rome. In addition to that, the price was extremely low for Rome (but of course during the low season).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: msw_24
Reviews.Content: Overall, good location, good service. It was nice to see there was an elevator, especially after a long day of walking 10 hours. The pizza place across from the hotel had the best pizza we tasted in any of the cities we visited in Italy. Also, having the internet cafe and calling point nearby was a great convenience...it was $0.25 a minute to call the U.S., which saved us spending a lot more on a sim card. The actual room was very clean, and they did not give us a hard time at all about coming in a few hours before check-in time. The staff persons we dealt with all gave us useful and accurate information.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: galway_gal_7
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just returned from a long weekend in Rome to celebrate our anniversary. We wanted a nice place to stay, that was reasonably priced and in a good location. The Hotel Galatea definitely ticked all those boxes!! It was late at night when we arrived (2am), and as said in a previous review, the hotel entrance left a lot to be desired!! The hotel is on the 3rd floor of an old palace, and you have to go in through a large gateway and through a dark courtyard to find the entrance to the stairwell and the quirky little elevator to bring you up to bring you up to the 3rd floor. At this stage, my finace was starting to wonder what he had let himself in for!!!! Once you get to the third floor however and go through the door into the reception area, any doubts in your mind will be expelled. The reception area itself is decorated in a bright and modern fashion, and even at the late hour that we arrived, the receptionist on duty had perfect english, something you don't often find.
