The room itself was large and had everything we needed. The bed was a little harder than I would have liked, but you can't have everything!! The bathroom was bigger than most hotel bathrooms and the power in the shower was just the thing you needed to get you going in the morning. Unlike the previous review, our room had a large bath tub which was very welcome in the evening to soak my sore feet!! Breakfast was basic enough, but it had all the essentials and that it generally what you get on the continent. The rooms were cleaned daily and the reception staff were always very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was ideal as it was only a five minute walk from Repubblica metro station and from there you could get to all the historical sights and the Vatican. Compared to the other hotels in the area, the price was an absolute steal for the quality of service that we received, and on our next trip to Rome, we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: ocphotographer
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers were accurate in warning that the outside of the hotel looks quite dumpy. But the inside, as others have said, is very nice! There's a frosted glass entry door once you get to the floor of the hotel (there's an elevator) that opens to a very modern lobby. The double room was extremely large. The furnishings are in a monochromotic palette and contemporary style. Location is convenient to the Trevi Fountain area. The only thing I found lacking was an internet connection. Breakfast was included but was very minimal. Overall, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galatea is clean, modern and a peaceful refuge”
Reviews.Author: Rurik4464
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May during our first trip to Rome. It was in a great location, about equidistant between the Colosseum/Forum area and the Trevi Fountain. It's also a short walk to and from the train station, but situated on a quite street off of Via Nazionale, a main thoroughfare. This hotel was clean and modern and had a modern, spacious bathroom. The front desk staff was very pleasant and there was usually an english-speaking person on duty who could help us when we ran into a language barrier. They were very helpful in showing us the quickest route to different sites on the map. There was a good pizza place right next door, and a taxi stand just about a block or so away on Via Nazionale, so it was easy to get around. We thought that this hotel was a great find - the price was reasonable and the quality was a lot more than we had expected as budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordRoamer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Galatea 13-16 June 2007. The hotel has only been open for 6 months so everything is fairly new. The room was not large but adequate, furnishing, bed, and air con were fine. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was excellent (no bath). Location is ideal, only 15 minutes walk from the coliseum, but so quiet that you can hear songbirds. There are some good restaurants nearby and it is also close to a bus stop and cab rank. The cold buffet breakfast was fine with good coffee. Staff were helpful and most spoke good English. Only 2 minor negative points: •The bedroom lighting was not, good but this seems to be common to many hotels. •There were no English speaking channels on the TV, but who wants to watch TV when you are on holiday? Overall we strongly recommend this hotel. It is good value for money in an expensive city. We would definitely stay there again. ‘We’ are a couple from Oxfordshire and went to Rome to celebrate a 60th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlesthobo100
Reviews.Content: I looked for a while on the internet for a central, modern, reasonably priced hotel and glad to say wasn't disappointed by the Galatea Hotel. The hotel doesn't look like much when you're entering the building but there really is no need to worry. The location was perfect - few minutes from the Trevi Fountain and close enough to easliy walk to all the major sites of Rome. The hotel rooms were newly fitted out (the shower was amazing and never ran out of hot water!) and spotlessly clean, the staff were helpful and the breakfast was better than expected. We had a wonderful stay there and would definitely recommend it to friends and family. PS. The restaurant by the enterance to the hotel does wonderful pizzas!
